frameDefinitions: A Theme that is in motion assumes a new Direction in which it moves.
A particular piece of Information is evaluated for its accuracy.
An Entity has a Temperature characterized by the target.
An intentional Agent or a causing event (Cause) event causes a Theme which is already in motion to take a different Path or Direction, or reach a different Goal than the Original_path.
Item-1 and Item-2 are compatible with each other if they can exist or function together in some context without problems, conflict, or other undesirable situation.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer believing that some Phenomenon will take place in the future.
frameExamples: We took our chances and <t>turned</t> right by a petrol station and, bingo, there she was--Fir Park.
Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> information?
The pan is already too <t>hot</t> to touch.

The hotel business didn't last - especially after the construction of a railroad
<t>diverted</t> travelers a few miles west to what is now the village of Eagle
Make sure your site is <t>compatible</t> with any browser.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the object which moves. In many sentences this role will be expressed as something which moves under its own power. However, this role is not <ment>required</ment> to be an animate mover, so it is different from a self-mover.
The new direction in which the <fen>Theme</fen> continues its motion.
The time at which the change of direction takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the setting where the change of direction during the Theme's motion occurs.
The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
The event which communicates the <fen>Information</fen>.
The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Temperature</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Degree</fen> for the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The entity that is in motion, and changes path due to the action of an Agent or due to a Cause.

The route that the <fen>Theme</fen> was originally headed for.  In cases when the <fen>Theme</fen> is an intentional actor or is controlled by an intentional actor, the <fen>Original_path</fen> correlates with the (former) plan of the actor.  In other cases, the <fen>Original_path</fen> corresponds to what would be expected for the path of the <fen>Theme</fen> from general principles or physics.  (In some cases, the <fen>Original_path</fen> may indicate the intended destination, and not just the path, of the <fen>Theme</fen>.)
The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up travelling after being diverted.
The location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in after being redirected.

This role is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the current deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that does not necessarily correspond to the <fen>Goal</fen>.  Often <fen>Direction</fen> is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the <fen>Theme</fen>, the orientation imposed by an implicit observer, or the inherent orientation of the scene.
An individual that determines the change in course of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
An event that brings about the change in the <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the redirection of motion occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location at which the redirection occurs.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_1</fen> marks the grammatically more prominent of the two entities, i.e.the subject in active clauses, when they are expressed separately.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_2</fen> marks the grammatically less prominent of the <fen>Items</fen> when they are expressed separately.
This role is used when the <fen>Items</fen> are expressed jointly in a phrase, either a plural or a coordinated NP.
This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate a <fen>Parameter</fen> or respect in which the <fen>Items</fen> are said to be compatible, not in conflict.

This is the person who believes some Phenomenon will take place in the future. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: <fex name='Cognizer'>Pat</fex> <t>expects</t> that the Yankees will win the World Series.

This is what the Cognizer believes will happen in the future. It can be expressed as a Finite Clause Complement, an NP Object, or a VP Complement with or without an NP Object (see General Grammatical Observations):
An entity that serves as the focus of a predicted <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the prediction.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> foresees the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
listRoleExamples: At that point <fex>the truck in front of me</fex> turned right into the huge ditch/field that separates the interstate from the access road.
Eventually, though, I backtracked to Kel Tole and hung a <fex>left</fex> toward Kilgal Tole.
<fex>Then</fex> I turned left onto 220th Street.
Turn right <fex>at the stop light</fex> and follow Park Avenue.
<fex>That statement</fex> is totally incorrect.
<fex>He</fex> is correct
<fex>The soup</fex>'s too hot.
The skillet had a temperature <fex>of 230 F</fex>
VTA detoured motorists <fex>from southbound I-880</fex> onto Airport Boulevard to access Coleman Avenue.
Traffic was redirected Tuesday <fex>along Melrose Avenue</fex> to make way for the scoreboard columns, Mellecker said.
Not knowing any better, he redirected people <fex>to the city center</fex>.
Flight 93 left Newark, NJ, earlier that day, bound for San Francisco, but it was hijacked by four terrorists who diverted it <fex>back toward Washington, DC</fex> .
When we ended up over in Marrakech, or Dakar, <fex>they</fex> diverted us up to Tobruk.

We even got a bonus morning in Tokyo's international airport when <fex>a bad storm</fex>
diverted us on the way to Asia.
<fex>Last Tuesday</fex> they were detouring everybody down onto 5th avenue .
They redirected us <fex name=''>at the corner of Alstone and Bokchoy Avenue</fex>.
<fex>That technology</fex> turned out not to be compatible with the existing devices
My computer is not compatible <fex>with my new printer</fex>.
<fex>Your socks</fex> don't match.
The two applications are compatible <fex>in their essential features</fex>.
Pat expects <fex>that the Yankees will win the World Series</fex>.
Predictions <fex>about stock prices</fex> are notoriously undependable.
She predicted the outcry <fex>several months ago</fex>.
<fex>Even at the far side of the house</fex> I could predict what was going on the kitchen.
